meta.title: Park Babelsberg Potsdam ‚Äì Practical Info, Toilets, Paths & Highlights
meta.description: All practical information for your visit: Where are the toilets? Which paths are accessible? Real photos show what to expect. For families, seniors, dog owners.

hero.title: Parks and Palaces in Potsdam-Babelsberg
hero.subtitle: Culture, Nature and Recreation on the Banks of the Havel
hero.lead: Discover the UNESCO World Heritage parks and cultural monuments on the banks of the Havel River. With practical information about locations, directions and current conditions on site.

funfacts.title: Did You Know?
funfacts.subtitle: Fascinating facts about the UNESCO World Heritage parks in Potsdam

unesco.title: UNESCO World Heritage
unesco.text: The Potsdam cultural landscape was inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1990 ‚Äì together with Sanssouci Palace.

hectares.title: Hectares of Parkland
hectares.text: Park Babelsberg covers 124 hectares ‚Äì equivalent to about 174 football fields!

kaiser.title: Emperor Wilhelm I
kaiser.text: Babelsberg Palace was the summer residence of Emperor Wilhelm I ‚Äì built by Karl Friedrich Schinkel.

architects.title: Famous Architects
architects.text: Schinkel, Persius and Strack ‚Äì three architectural geniuses created this neo-Gothic masterpiece together.

shoreline.title: Shoreline
shoreline.text: Over 7 kilometers of scenic riverside paths along the Havel invite you to stroll and linger.

potsdam.title: Potsdam Conference
potsdam.text: The historic Potsdam Conference took place at Cecilienhof Palace (New Garden) in 1945.

areale.title: The 4 Areas ‚Äì One Landscape, Four Experiences
areale.subtitle: From historic parkland to royal palace ‚Äì discover the connected UNESCO World Heritage areas on the banks of the Havel.
areale.label: Area

areal1.title: Park Babelsberg
areal1.description: The 124-hectare English landscape park on the banks of the Havel is a masterpiece of garden art. UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1990.

areal2.title: Babelsberg Palace
areal2.description: The neo-Gothic summer palace of Emperor Wilhelm I majestically overlooks the Havel. Built 1833-1849 to designs by Karl Friedrich Schinkel.

areal3.title: New Garden
areal3.description: An early masterpiece of landscape design on the Heiliger See. Created from 1787 for Friedrich Wilhelm II. The Potsdam Conference took place here in 1945.

areal4.title: Park Glienicke
areal4.description: The southernmost part of the UNESCO World Heritage landscape at the Glienicke Bridge. A hidden gem with Italian-inspired architecture.

finder.title: Find What You Need
finder.subtitle: Interactive map with toilets, restaurants, parking and public transport stops. With location navigation and live timetable information.

categories.subtitle: Quickly find what you're looking for ‚Äì from attractions to practical services.

castles.title: Palaces & Buildings
castles.description: Neo-Gothic palaces, observation towers and historic buildings from different eras.

gastro.title: Dining
gastro.description: Restaurants, caf√©s, snack bars and beer gardens within walking distance of the park.

practical.description: Toilets, parking and public transport with live data.

arrival.title: Getting Here & Parking
arrival.description: All information about directions, parking and public transport.

rules.title: Rules & Regulations
rules.description: What's allowed? Cycling, picnicking, swimming and more.

highlights.title: The Most Beautiful Places
highlights.subtitle: Discover the historic buildings and landscape highlights in the UNESCO World Heritage Park Babelsberg.

schloss.title: Babelsberg Palace
schloss.description: Neo-Gothic summer palace of Emperor Wilhelm I. Built 1833-1849 by Schinkel, Persius and Strack. UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1990.

flatow.title: Flatow Tower
flatow.description: 46m high observation tower with 360¬∞ panorama over Potsdam. Built 1853-1856. Open May‚ÄìOctober, Sat/Sun 10am-5:30pm.

uferweg.title: North Riverside Path
uferweg.description: Scenic walking path with open panoramic views over the Tiefer See. Perfect for relaxing, photography and enjoying sunsets.

matrosenhaus.title: Sailor's House
matrosenhaus.description: Historic boathouse on the Havel riverbank from the 19th century. Now an event location with romantic water views.

arrival.title: Getting Here & Parking
arrival.subtitle: The best way to get to Park Babelsberg ‚Äì by car, public transport or bicycle.

car.title: By Car
car.distance: Distance to palace: 1.2 km (15 min walk)

transit.title: By Public Transport (Recommended!)
transit.benefitDetail: no parking search! Live departure times available on our map.

tips.title: Parking Tips for Drivers
tips.tip1: Tip 1: Weekend visitors should arrive before 10am or switch to public transport.
tips.tip2: Tip 2: Over 1200 additional parking spaces in the area (see map above).
tips.tip3: Tip 3: Park & Ride: Parking at Griebnitzsee S-Bahn station (free), then 15 min walk.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to the most important questions about your visit.

q1.question: Where can I find toilets in the park?
q1.answer: Public toilets are signposted at the main entrances. Use our Location Finder to find the nearest toilet. Some require a fee (approx. ‚Ç¨0.50), others are free.

q2.question: Is the park accessible?
q2.answer: The paved main paths are easily accessible for wheelchairs and strollers. Some nature trails have inclines and are less suitable. The Flatow Tower is not accessible (only accessible via stairs).

q3.question: Can I grill or picnic in the park?
q3.answer: Picnicking is allowed on the lawns. Grilling is prohibited throughout the park (fire safety). Please take your trash with you or dispose of it in the provided bins.

q4.question: Can I cycle through the park?
q4.answer: Cycling is only allowed on paved main paths. Cycling is prohibited on hiking trails and nature paths. Follow signs on site. More details in our park regulations.

q5.question: Are dogs allowed in the park?
q5.answer: Yes, dogs are allowed but must be kept on a leash. Please bring dog waste bags and dispose of them in the bins.

q6.question: Can I swim in the Havel?
q6.answer: No, swimming in the Havel is prohibited (no lifeguard, current, boat traffic). Alternative swimming spots are available at Heiliger See in the New Garden.

q7.question: Are there guided tours of the park?
q7.answer: Yes, the Prussian Palaces and Gardens Foundation offers regular tours. Dates and booking at www.spsg.de.

q8.question: How long should I plan for a visit?
q8.answer: For a relaxed walk: 2-3 hours. With palace tour and Flatow Tower: 4-5 hours. For all 4 areas: full day trip recommended.

photography.title: Photography Tips for Park Babelsberg
photography.intro: Telephoto 135‚Äì200mm for sight lines (Pfingstberg/Marmorpalais), polarizer for water, ND 6‚Äì10 stops for silky-smooth Havel. Drones prohibited. Stay on paths.

lightMatrix.title: Light Matrix: Spots √ó Time of Day

composition.title: Composition & Perspectives
composition.tip1: S-curve of the riverside path as leading line to the bridge ‚Äì guides the viewer's eye through the image
composition.tip2: Telephoto compression from Flatow Tower to Pfingstberg/Marmorpalais ‚Äì compresses landscape
composition.tip3: Steam Engine House: Long exposure at water with ND filter for silky-smooth effect

hiddenGems.title: Hidden Gems
hiddenGems.dampfmaschine: Steam Engine House: Disguised as 'Norman castle' ‚Äì engineering for palace fountain, not defense
hiddenGems.gerichtslaube: Court Arcade: Medieval Berlin town hall fragment (13th c.), relocated here in 1871 as 'teahouse curiosity'
hiddenGems.disclaimer: Historic peculiarities. Please check current accessibility on site.

geocaching.title: Geocaching Hotspot
geocaching.description: Multi-caches 'Park Babelsberg 01/02' (Owner: g_r) lead through the park with stations including Flatow Tower, Marstall, Sailor's House.
geocaching.warning: ‚ö†Ô∏è High muggle density ‚Äì log discreetly. Stay on paths (UNESCO World Heritage/SPSG park regulations). Drones prohibited. Check cache status on geocaching.com (as of 2025-10-31).

running.title: Running & Mindfulness
running.description: Hilly profile for training stimulus ‚Äì steady ups and downs train strength and endurance.

routes.title: Running Routes (GPX Downloads)
routes.disclaimer: Community suggestions. Stay on paths on site (paved main paths only).

photography.title: Photo Spots in Focus
photography.intro: Belvedere layering: Water‚ÄìBridge‚ÄìPalace with telephoto 135‚Äì200mm. Warm afternoon light. Stay on paths, drones prohibited.

spots.title: Composition & Perspectives
spots.casino: Casino Glienicke: Arcade framing + reflections in calm conditions ‚Äì use symmetry
spots.loggia: B√∂ttcherberg/Loggia Alexandra: Layering to Babelsberg Palace ‚Äì telephoto compresses landscape
spots.stibadium: Stibadium (Persius): Semicircular tea pavilion as niche motif ‚Äì architectural details

history.title: Spy Bridge History & Curiosities
history.bridge: Glienicke Bridge: Exchange history (Powers 1962, Abel 1962, Shcharansky 1986) ‚Äì Guided story walks available
history.curiosity: "Little Curiosity": Doric observation post ‚Äì perfect sight line to the bridge
history.frigate: Schinkel's Dummy Frigate: Historic prop ship (1840s), now lost ‚Äì architectural illusion
history.disclaimer: Historic peculiarities. Story walks organized externally (not SPSG).

events.title: Event Potential (Premium/Small-scale)

storytelling.title: üìö Storytelling Formats
storytelling.description: Exclusive dinners/panels on espionage themes in historic setting

photography.title: üì∑ Golden Hour Workshops
photography.description: Product launches for camera/optics with professional backdrop

events.disclaimer: Event permission from SPSG required. Limited capacity.

photography.title: Photo Spots in the New Garden
photography.intro: Morning frontal light at Marble Palace. Diffuse light for Cecilienhof textures. Stay on paths, drones prohibited.

spots.title: Composition & Perspectives
spots.marmorpalais: Marble Palace: East shore ‚Üí symmetrical reflections (morning) in calm conditions
spots.cecilienhof: Cecilienhof: Brick/roof textures ‚Äì B&W suitable in haze/fog
spots.see: Heiliger See: Layers in morning mist ‚Äì atmospheric mood

history.title: History Trail "Forbidden City" (2.5 km / 14 stations)
history.description: KGB restricted zone from 1945 ‚Äì Soviet military town in the middle of Potsdam. Leistikowstra√üe 1 Memorial: Authentic cells of Soviet intelligence service.
history.warning: ‚ÑπÔ∏è Respectful visit recommended. Follow on-site instructions. Guided tours bookable via memorial.

esoteric.title: Esoteric Traces of Friedrich Wilhelm II
esoteric.pyramid: Ice Chamber as Pyramid: Masonic symbolism ‚Äì not just practical, but spiritually charged
esoteric.temple: Palace Kitchen as 'Sunken Temple': Architectural allusion to ancient mysteries
esoteric.disclaimer: Historic interpretations. Accessibility varies by structure.

movement.title: Running & Yoga in the New Garden
movement.description: Flat ~4km loop ‚Äì ideal for relaxed running. Quiet meadows away from main paths for yoga/mindfulness.

yoga.title: Yoga & Mindfulness
yoga.tip1: Equipment: Mat robust (meadows can be damp), layered clothing for morning chill
yoga.tip2: Time window: Early morning = quieter & cooler, fewer visitors
yoga.tip3: Spots: Quiet level meadows away from main paths ‚Äì stay on permitted areas

social.title: ‚òï Social Hotspots Guide
social.description: The parks as a "third place": youth culture at Heiliger See, Caf√© Matschke as a link to the art scene, palace concerts as a cultural ritual. From autonomous zones to intellectual exchange and cultivated community events ‚Äì the parks as a foundation of urban identity.

intro.title: The Havel as a Stage
intro.subtitle: While most visitors explore Potsdam's park landscapes on foot, a completely new, almost magical perspective opens up from the water. The masterfully staged visual axes by Lenn√© and P√ºckler-Muskau were deliberately designed to unfold their full splendor from the water. Glide across the Havel in a canoe, SUP or on an excursion boat and experience how the castles and gardens present themselves as a perfectly composed shore landscape.

aktiv.title: Active on the Water
aktiv.subtitle: For all those who want to explore the park landscape on their own, there are numerous opportunities to get active. Whether sporty in a kayak or relaxed on a SUP ‚Äì Potsdam's waters are a paradise for paddlers.

kanu.title: Canoe & Kayak
kanu.description: Rent a canoe or kayak and paddle along the shores of Park Babelsberg, the New Garden and Park Glienicke. Discover hidden bays and enjoy the tranquility on the water. Numerous rental stations in Potsdam offer a large selection of boats for beginners and advanced paddlers.

sup.title: Stand-Up-Paddling (SUP)
sup.description: Experience the parks from a SUP and enjoy a unique workout in the fresh air. The calm waters of the Havel are ideal for beginners. Some rental stations also offer guided SUP tours and yoga classes on the water.

touren.title: Relaxed Tours
touren.subtitle: Sit back and enjoy the passing scenery on one of the numerous boat trips. Various shipping companies offer round trips that take you to the most beautiful places in the Potsdam park landscape.

weltkulturerbe.title: World Heritage Tour
weltkulturerbe.description: The 3-hour "World Heritage Tour" by the STERN+KREIS shipping company is a classic. It takes you past Babelsberg and Cecilienhof palaces, the Glienicke Bridge, Peacock Island and many other highlights. An audio guide in German and English explains the history and special features of the places.
weltkulturerbe.button: More about the World Heritage Tour

regeln.title: What you need to know
regeln.subtitle: To make your trip on the water an unforgettable experience, you should observe a few things.

regeln.title: Rules & Safety
regeln.description: Observe the applicable shipping rules and be considerate of other water sports enthusiasts and commercial shipping. Wear a life jacket and check the weather before you start.

umwelt.title: Environmental Protection
umwelt.description: The shore areas of the parks are valuable habitats for many animal and plant species. Keep your distance from reed zones and overgrown shores and avoid noise. Take your rubbish with you.

anstieg.title: Jetties & Breaks
anstieg.description: Use only the designated jetties and rest areas. Mooring on the banks of the parks is generally not permitted in order to protect the vegetation.
